A0040.title: Certificate Pinning (SSL Pinning)
A0040.definition: Pinning the server's SSL certificate in the client.
A0040.description: Also known as SSL Pinning. Certificate pinning is a protective measure that pins the server's SSL certificate in the client, preventing attackers from intercepting and modifying network traffic via a man-in-the-middle attack.
A0040.limitation: Certificate pinning is a relatively basic security defense mechanism aimed at raising the bar for man-in-the-middle attacks. However, sophisticated attackers can use various techniques to replace the pinned SSL certificate in the client with a custom certificate to bypass this defense.
